meanings.definition: A surgical procedure in which the ileum is brought through an opening in the abdominal wall to create a stoma for the elimination of waste.
meanings.sent1: After the ileostomy, the patient's waste exits through the stoma.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the purpose of the ileostomy to the patient.
meanings.sent3: During the ileostomy, the waste took a different route out of the body.
meanings.sent4: The ileostomy was like a new door for waste removal in the abdomen.
meanings.sent5: The ileostomy changed how waste left the body, making it easier for the patient.

meanings.definition: The opening created in the abdominal wall during an ileostomy procedure.
meanings.sent1: The nurse carefully monitored the healing of the ileostomy opening.
meanings.sent2: The ileostomy opening required regular cleaning to prevent infection.
meanings.sent3: The ileostomy opening seemed like a tiny window in the abdomen.
meanings.sent4: The ileostomy opening was a direct path for waste to leave the body.
meanings.sent5: The ileostomy opening was a crucial part of the surgical procedure for waste elimination.
